pageContext.claim: “We’ve had bigger storms than this. And if you go back into the 1930s and the 1940s and you take a look we’ve had storms over the years that have been bigger than this. If you go back into the teens, you’ll see storms that were as big or bigger. So we did have two horrific storms, epic storms. But if you go back into the ’30s and ’40s and the teens, you’ll see storms that were very similar or even bigger, okay?”
pageContext.analysis: "Bigger" could mean any number of things. Trump is using barometric pressure to discuss the impact of Hurricane Harvey. But Trump's statement does not address the economic costs of these major storms or the toll they take on people living in coastal areas. And the intensity of a storm doesn't necessarily correlate to how much damage it can cause.
